text: if you want to know how Iranians feel
about this deal look no further than the
streets of Tehran there the answer seems
clear their celebrations continued late
into the night this was the best thing
that could happen I was very happy when
I heard this news many things were
definitely improved relations between
Iran and Europe and other countries were
greatly improved and the pressure on the
people will ease a little and they
weren't just celebrating on the streets
but on social media as well despite
sites like Twitter being officially
banned
this map shows hashtags like Iran talks
and Iran deal were trending especially
around Tehran used in tweets like this
capturing the late night celebrations
and sharing the photos some wanting to
mark what they see as an historic step
but why are people in Iran so jubilant
about this high-level political
agreement well it's because they believe
the lifting of sanctions will directly
benefit their everyday lives if prices
are going to be a load and and I think
that we will apear the people will be
able to buy more and I think that we
will have better life I get on base
remember college or me if Iran can be
more friendly with the international
community that would be much better for
atella better fight the sanctions have
had a negative effect on the Iranian
economy the country went into recession
for a couple of years growth has been
restored at the moment it has hurt
people because it is less in their
ability to to purchase goods and some
people have lost their jobs but for all
the optimism the effects are unlikely to
be felt immediately this is still only a
framework deal that's been carved out
and the exact details may yet be some
way off Ben bland BBC news
